parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Camera Control

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Create a camera or a seagull object on the given position. The creation happens immediately and doesn't wait for [[camCommit]].<br>
Among other commands, [[cameraEffect]] must be used to enter the camera's view and [[camDestroy]] to delete the created camera. See also [[:Category:Command Group: Camera Control|Camera Control]].<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>important</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>
* Other objects can be created this way, but vehicles created with [[camCreate]] cannot be entered
* Any unit created with [[camCreate]] will remain static
* Unlike [[createVehicle]], objects are created exactly at the given position, without consideration of the surrounding objects</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> type [[camCreate]] position

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> type: [[String]] - camera type, one of the following:
* "camera"
* "seagull" (a crow in Arma 2)
* "camconstruct"
* "camcurator" (Since Arma 3 Zeus)
* "crowe" (crow - Arma 3)
* or any vehicle class suitable to be spawned with cam

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> position: [[Array]] - format [[PositionAGL]] - position to create the object at

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Object]] - the created camera
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_cam = "camera" [[camCreate]] ([[ASLToAGL]] [[eyePos]] [[player]]);</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_flr = "flare" [[camCreate]] ([[position]] _myPlane); <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>works too</value></part></template></code>

</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> camCreated objects are only visible locally (meaning they are client-side effects).

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[camCommand]], [[camDestroy]], [[camSetFocus]], [[camCommit]], [[setPiPEffect]], [[createVehicle]], [[createUnit]], [[showCinemaBorder]], [[cameraEffect]], [[cameraEffectEnableHUD]]
</value></part></template>
